notesStmt.note: Thanks go to Pyndap for her patience during all the hours that I spent on this project!

projectDesc.p: This dictionary comes to you through nice people making it available for free and for good. It is part of the FreeDict project, http://freedict.org/. This project aims to make translating dictionaries available for free. Your contributions are welcome!

revisionDesc.change: 2010-11-01 Piotr Bański: Conversion of TEI P4 source into P5 via tools/xsl/freedict_P4toP5.xsl; manual clean-up.
2005-08-30 Michael BunkReached 2260 entries, corrected 10 spelling mistakes in English words, found with the current FreeDict-Editor
2005-05-04 Michael BunkReached 1900 entries, split examples from their translations

sense.def: the first letter (Capital A, and small letter a) of the Khasi Alphabet. It is a sign of a Vowel (Sawa-hi). Its sound is very open, more than the a of the English exclamation Ah!
indicating joy, sorrow, surprise, warning
sense.note: In English the interjections A, Ah are written with a capital letter, but it does not seem justified to follow this rule also in Khasi.
The Apostrophe (') is often used in Khasi to indicate that some letter or letters have been omitted, specially in compound words: ar'ti-ar'jat, 'tiewkulab, for arkti-arkjat, syntiew-kulab.

sense.def: imitative for the cry of the crow

entry.def: red colour used by Hindus during the Holi festival

sense.def: What a bad smell!

Ki nongjngohkai, ki para klass jong ngi, ki pynshlur ïa ngi.

Ki bashah jop ki long ki banyngkong eh ban ïaroh ïa ngi.
The losers are the first to congratulate us.
Ki la ïoh ka jinghikai kaba kham bha.
Thoh beit ïa ki kyrteng jong ki katkum ka jinglah.
Write their names in order of merit.
Ka la pyndap shoin ïa u khra da ki maw.
She completely filled the pot with stones.
Ka trei lut ïa ki kam ïing kam sem baroh.
She did all kinds of household work.
Please give me one cup of tea!

form.orth: u bnai u la pyllun bha

cit.quote: Mynta u bnai u la pyllun bha.
U Sneng u ïathuh pynshoi ïa nga ha i babu.
Sneng spoke ill of me to our teacher.
I hep i bha dak shibun.
My sister writes a good hand.
U Phup u dei u ksew u balalot bad u long u batuh shibun.
U shabi um ïadei ïa ka tala.
cry at the top of one's voice
U shiah dohkha u sahkut ha u pdot jong nga.
The fishbone sticks in my throat.

form.orth: ka sngi ka dang shu sdang mih

sense.note: lit. the sun is just beginning to rise

cit.quote: Ki khynnah ki pyrthuh ïa ka kuku.
U khynnah ap masi u dang pynbam phlang ïa ki masi ha them.
Ong ïa u ban nym batai stad!
Tell him to hold his tongue!
Wat ïakajia bad la u paramarjan!
Ngin pynlut ïa ka shuti puja ha la shnong.
Lada ki khnai ki lah ban bam ïa u nar, u kbeit u lah ban rong noh ïa u khynnah.
Kumta ki leit ha khmat u nongbishar.
Nga la pang khieshoh la slem.
I have been suffering from fever for a long time.
I always get up before daylight.
Phim dei ban siew shuh ïa ka bainong u pion.
You will not have to pay the postman's wages.
Ki pion ki phriang ïa ki shithi.
The peons spread out the letters.
Tar noh ïa ka lyngkhot kotsada na kjat.
Tear off the strip of paper at the bottom.
I mama i shong kham hajan shibun ban ïa i kong.
Our uncle lives much nearer than our sister.
Nga la lah sain ïa ka kot phah tyngka.
I had signed the money order.

sense.def: with the whole weight of the body

cit.quote: Sngewbha ban tah stam ha kine ki shithi baroh ar.
Ngan pyrshang ban bishar hok ïa ka jingïakajia jongphi.
Ngan ïasam ïa u kek bad ban ai ïa phi uwei uwei mar shiteng.
Ka ri jong ngi ka la ïakynduh bad ka jingshai na sepngi.
Our country came into contact with western civilisation.
Ka rel kan sa mareh suki ynda poi hajan ka jaka sangeh.
The train will be running slowly when it comes near the station.

sense.def: Together with 'yn' indication of future continuous tense.

cit.quote: It will be raining the whole day.

sense.def: Together with 'yn' indication fo future continuous tense.

cit.quote: Ka long ka bajem ban nang ïa ki akor babha.
It is easy to learn good manners.
La ai khnang artylli ki khmat ha ngi ba ngin lah ban ïohi shibun kiei kiei bad kham stad manla ka sngi.
Teng teng, la kumno kumno, ka long ka babha eh ban shu sngap jar, lada ka jingshisha kan nym pynbha ïano íano ruh.
Sometimes, in the end, it is better to keep silent, when the truth will not do any good either.
Pyrshang barabor ban teh lakam ïa la u thylliej.
Always try to restrain your tongue.
Wat ju pynjakhlia ïa la u thylliej da ki ktien basngewsaitmet!
Never spoil your tongue with ugly words!

sense.def: Together with 'yn' indication of Future Perfect tense.

cit.quote: Un jin da la poi ïing katne por.
He will have reached home by this time.
La pynlong ka jingïalang paitbah manla ka por ha kane ka snem.
A public meeting was made all the time this year.
U syiar u ïai kynih naduh dang-shai byrngut.
The cock had been crowing since morning.
U la dem pang khieshoh la bun teng.
He had often been suffering from fever.
Um ju ïohi ïa uta u briew mynshuwa.
He had never seen this man before.
Hamar kane uta u briew u la piam khop ïa ka ryndang jong u.
Nga ïohsngew i hynmen jong phi i leit Bilat mo?
I head your brother has gone to England, is it so?
To nuima, nga sngewbha ban ïathuh ïa phi ïa kaba nga lah.
Very well, I am glad to tell you anything that I can.
Ka lieng ka hiar arsut na Hugly.
The ship started off down the Hugly.
I bah i sngew diaw shibun haba i sngewthuh ba in jah noh na la shnong bun snem.
My brother felt very sad as he realised that he was leaving his native land for many years.
Uta u briew u la kren katto katne ki ktien rngai.
That man said some magic words.
Um shym lah ban ïoh ïa ka sharak rngai na ka bynta jong kaba u la wan khnang.
He could not get the magic light for which he had come.
Sngewbha map ïa nga ba nga bakla.
Please forgive me that I committed a mistake.
Ki kitkhia bha ïa ka kam.
They pay due attention to the work.
Ka ai isynei ïa ki baduk.
She gives alms to the poor.
U kpa u la aiti ïa la ka spah ha la u khun.
The father made over his property to his son.
Ngi ujor pyrshah ïa ka jinghikai jong u.
Ka kali ka la tylliat ïa u ksew.
The car ran over the dog.
Ka la aiwai ïa ka ïing.
U 'riewsaid jong u ruh um imat ïadei jingmut bad nga.
His lawyer too did not seem to agree with me.
U leh bha shibun ha la ki jingpule.
He is getting on very well with his studies.
Ngi ïakut jingmut ban pyndep kloi ïa ka jingtrei katba lah.
We have made up our own mind to finish the work as fast as we can.
U Ram u la shim niat ïa ka jingput bad u ïaleit noh bad u khynnah syiem.

form.orth: badei ïa ki kam hima sima

cit.quote: Ngin ïa ong lang laiphew tynka bad tang katta.
We shall say thirty rupees and no more.
Ka long kaba sngewphylla shisha shisha.
Phi la lah phah shaw doktor?
You had sent for a doctor?
Katba u dang kren, u la kyndong ïa la ka ryndang sopti bad u la pyni ïa ka sohkliang ka baheh ha ka ksangkti.
Um pynsngew ïa ka jingsneng jong nga.
He turned a deaf ear to my advice.
U ïashim bynta ha ka jingïalehkmen.
He takes part in the rejoicing.
Nga kwah ban ring ïa ka jingmut jong phi sha kane ka kam.
I want to draw your attention to this matter.
Ngi la duh lehnoh ei ïa ka burom ka jong u Blei.
U ïakhlad noh bad la ki kmie ki kpa.
He takes leave of his parents.
It will be hard for you.
Ki la beh ïa u namar ka kam sniew.
I kmie jong ki i la ïap mynba ki dang rit eh.
Their mother died when they were very young.

sense.note: a black fruit similar in look and size to grapes
